feat.name: Battle Pair
entries: You've become experienced fighting back-to-back with others, and can predict the movements of likewise experienced combatants. As a result, you gain the following benefits when you're fighting near an ally who has also taken this feat:

items: You can share your space with the ally and receive none of the normal penalties for doing so. When you do, you gain a bonus to attacks and saving throws equal to half their proficiency bonus, and a +1 bonus to AC.
When you are within 10 feet of the ally and you both must make a saving throw against an effect, you may choose to use their bonus instead of your own.

When you are within 10 feet of the ally on their turn and they make an attack or force an enemy to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to make a preemptive weapon attack against the same enemy. If your attack hits, their attack has advantage or their target has disadvantage on their saving throw.

entries: When you're fighting near multiple allies who have taken this feat, you can choose which of their bonuses to use, but the bonuses don't stack.

feat.name: Blade Master

entries: This feat is taken/modified from the Cormyr: Land of the Purple Dragon: https://www.dmsguild.com/product/281159/Cormyr-Land-of-the-Purple-Dragon

You have trained extensively with the use of bladed weapons, perhaps with a professional instructor such as a master-at-arms. You know how to use bladed weapons not only for attack, but also for defense.

items: When you draw a greatsword, longsword, scimitar, rapier, dagger, or shortsword, you may use a bonus action to make an attack with the pommel of your weapon. This attack deals no damage, but if it hits, your next attack before the end of your turn has advantage.

When you miss a melee attack using a greatsword, longsword, scimitar, rapier, dagger, or shortsword, you can pull the weapon back in a swift draw cut as a reaction. Make an additional attack with the weapon against the same target.

When an enemy would hit you with a melee weapon attack that is not a critical hit, you may use your reaction to make an attack roll with your greatsword, longsword, scimitar, rapier, dagger, or shortsword. This attack deals no damage, but if the result of your attack roll equals or exceeds their attack roll, their attack misses.

feat.name: Counter-Ambush Training
entries: You've been trained to turn things around when caught off guard, giving you the following benefits:

items: As a reaction on your first turn in combat, you can rally your comrades into a more favourable position: choose a number of your allies up to your proficiency bonus within 60 feet. If they can see or hear you, they can immediately use their reaction to move up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks. You can choose to instead use this reaction at the end of the first round.
You gain a +2 bonus to initiative checks.

feat.name: Defensive Fighter
entries: While wielding a melee weapon with proficiency, you gain the following benefits:

items: When you take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Dodge} action, you can add your proficiency bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn.
When you're hit by a weapon attack, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss instead.

entries: You can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Dodge} action as a bonus action a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus, regaining all uses when you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Favourite Spell
entries: You’ve mastered the use of a particular spell. Pick a spell of 1st through 3rd level that you can cast with your Spellcasting feature to permanently gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever you cast your favourite spell, it is treated as if it were cast from a spell slot one level higher.
It is always prepared, and doesn't count against the number of spells you may prepare or know.

Pick one {@filter Metamagic|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=MM} ability from the sorcerer's list that costs no more than 1 sorcery point. Your favourite spell receives the benefit of that metamagic whenever it is cast. Metamagic effects that depend on your Charisma modifier instead depend on your spellcasting ability modifier.

entries: This feat can be taken multiple times. Each time this feat is taken after the first, you may do one of the following:

items: Pick a new spell to gain the benefits of this feat. The new spell can be up to 5th level if you've taken this feat once already, or up to 7th level if you've taken it twice or more.

Pick a new {@filter Metamagic|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=MM} ability from the sorcerer's list that costs a number of sorcery points up to the number of times you have taken this feat. The new ability replaces the metamagic of one spell already affected by this feat.

feat.name: Hello There!
entries: You project an air of confidence that unsettles your foes.

items: When hidden and outnumbered by enemies, for one minute after revealing yourself to them, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks and you may take the maximum result on initiative checks.

entries: If you roll initiative during that time, you gain the following benefits during the first round:

items: One additional action which you may take at the end of any one turn, which can only be {@action Attack} (one weapon attack), {@action Dash}, {@action Dodge}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object}.
Advantage on attacks, ability checks, and saving throws.
Enemy attacks against you have disadvantage, and they have disadvantage on saving throws against your abilities.

feat.name: I Have the High Ground!

prerequisite.other: Charisma 13 or higher for the moral high ground

entries: When the high ground exists in the battlefield, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on checks and saving throws made to acquire or retain the high ground from your point of view.
After acquiring the high ground, if you haven't willingly given it up within the past minute, you have advantage on melee attacks until the end of your next turn or until you lose the high ground.

When a creature attempts to take the high ground from you, you may use your reaction to make a melee attack against them with advantage. If it hits, they can't take the high ground from you on that turn.

feat.name: Lucky

entries: This feat is a nerfed version of the {@feat Lucky|PHB} published in the Player's Handbook.
You have inexplicable luck that seems to kick in at just the right moment.

You have 3 luck points. Whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can spend one luck point to roll an additional {@dice d20}. You can choose to spend one of your luck points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

You can also spend one luck point when an attack roll is made against you. Roll a {@dice d20}, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or yours. If more than one creature spends a luck point to influence the outcome of a roll, the points cancel each other out; no additional dice are rolled.

When you spend a luck point, if you had advantage or disadvantage on the roll, the d20 replaces the lower die from that roll. If you spend a luck point on an attack against you which had advantage or disadvantage, the d20 replaces the higher die from that roll.
You regain your expended luck points when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Maneuverer

entries: This feat is a half-feat version of {@feat Martial Adept|PHB} published in the Player's Handbook.
You're a martial but want to be creative sometimes, leading you to try more outlandish moves which might actually work!

items: You learn one {@filter maneuvers|optionalfeatures|feature type=MV:B} of your choice from among those available to the {@class fighter|phb|Battle Master|Battle Master|phb|2-0} archetype in the fighter class. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

You gain one superiority die, which is a {@dice d4} (this die is added to any superiority dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuvers. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Mediator
entries: You exude the good vibes of a person who can be trusted, giving you the following benefits:

items: You can add your proficiency bonus on ability checks made to mediate or negotiate in good faith. If you're already proficient with such an ability check, you can double your proficiency bonus for it.
When you use the {@action Help} action or are Helped by another creature, you may add a +2 bonus to the aided roll.
When you make a group ability check, everyone in the group may add a +2 bonus to their checks.

feat.name: Net Master
entries: Extensive training with nets has earned you the following benefits:

items: You don't suffer disadvantage when attacking a creature within 5 feet of you with a net, or when throwing a net up to its long range.
You can add your proficiency bonus to the DC, AC, and damage requirement for escaping or destroying your nets.
When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with a net, you can use a bonus action to attack with a one-handed weapon you are holding.

feat.name: Nocturnal
entries: You've spent a lot of time far from large settlements and grown accustomed to the quiet isolation of night. You've gained the following benefits as a result:

items: You have darkvision with a range of 15 feet. If you gain darkvision from any other source, its range is increased by 15 feet for you.
You have advantage on Perception checks relying on senses other than sight.

feat.name: One with the Flow
entries: You've learned to take advantage of the flow of the movements of creatures around you, giving you these benefits:

items: When your movement provokes multiple opportunity attacks at once or from adjacent creatures, all of the attacks have disadvantage.
You have advantage on ability checks to Tumble through or Overrun other creatures' spaces.
Other creatures' spaces don't count as difficult terrain for you, even if they're hostile or part of a crowd.

feat.name: Sea Legs
entries: Your time spent aboard boats has earned you the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in vehicles (water).
You have advantage on saving throws and ability checks against being knocked prone, grappled, restrained, or forcefully moved.
Climbing doesn't cost you extra movement.

feat.name: Smash Hit
entries: You know exactly where to strike a creature to make it loosen its grasp.
You may add your proficiency bonus to grapple checks (to grapple or to avoid or break a grapple), and may make such ability checks using Intelligence instead of Strength or Dexterity.

When you succeed on a check to break free from a grapple, your speed increases by 15 feet until the end of your turn. Additionally, the creature that grappled you must make a Constitution saving throw, DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability you used to break the grapple. If it fails, it's {@condition incapacitated} for a period of time depending on its size relative to yours (see the table below). If it fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it's {@condition stunned} instead of incapacitated.

While you have a creature grappled, you can use your action to force the creature to make the Constitution saving throw described above, DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability you used to grapple. If it passes the saving throw, it may immediately attempt to break the grapple (no action required) and may use its reaction to make an opportunity attack.

feat.name: Soul Guard
entries: Your will to survive in dire situations is admirable and infectious.

Any time you start your turn with 0 HP, gain hit points while at 0 HP, are resurrected, or use an effect that leaves you at 1 HP instead of 0 HP, you gain temp HP equal to your proficiency bonus plus half your level. If you have one failed death save when this occurs you double the amount of temp HP gained, if you have two failed death saves you triple it, and if you were resurrected you quadruple it. You may then use your reaction to {@action Dodge} and gain resistance to all damage for as long as you continue Dodging without taking any other actions.
Any time you restore hit points to a creature at 0 HP or resurrect a creature, they gain the same benefits using your level and proficiency bonus instead of their own.

feat.name: Unbreakable
entries: Your focus is unwavering, resulting in these benefits:

items: You may add half of your proficiency bonus to death saving throws.
When a concentration spell targeting you or your equipment ends, you can choose to retain the spell's effects until the end of your next turn.

Twice per long rest, when a spell you cast ends due to your concentration breaking or its duration expiring, you can muster some lingering power to extend it. The spell does not end until the start of your next turn or until you begin concentrating on another effect, but any new saving throw a creature makes against the spell automatically succeeds.

feat.name: Verticality
entries: You've grown accustomed to moving in a 3D space and gain these benefits:

items: You have a climb speed equal to your walking speed.
If you fall and aren't incapacitated, you roll two fewer d6s when calculating fall damage. If you fall while touching a vertical surface, you instead roll four fewer d6s.

feat.name: Violent Momentum
entries: Pressing the advantage is essential in a fight. Seize control of combat. You gain the following benefits:

items: The first time you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee weapon attack on your turn, you may use a bonus action to move up to your movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks and make a melee weapon attack on a new creature.

feat.name: Weapon Master

entries: This feat is a buffed version of the {@feat Weapon Master|PHB} published in the Player's Handbook.
You have trained extensively with the use of four weapons in particular, gaining the following benefits:

items: Choose four simple or martial weapons. If you're already proficient with a chosen weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to hit when using them. Otherwise, you gain proficiency with the weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Replicate Magic Item

entries: This artificer infusion is a buffed version of the original feature published in Tasha's Cauldron of Everything.

Using this infusion, you replicate a particular magic item. You can use this infusion multiple times at once; each time you do so, choose a magic item that you can make with it, picking from the Replicable Items tables below. A table's title tells you the level you must be in the class to choose an item from the table. Alternatively, you can choose the magic item from among the {@filter common magic items|items|type=!potion;!scroll|rarity=common} in the game, not including potions or scrolls. When you finish a short rest, you can replace the item you replicated with another one following the same prerequisites. If any charges or uses were expended for the old item, the same amount are expended for the new one.

In the tables, an item's entry tells you whether the item requires attunement. See the item's description in the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG} for more information about it, including the type of object required for its making.

entries.caption: Replicable Items (14th-Level Artificer)
rows: {@item Belt of Hill Giant Strength||Belt of hill giant strength}

optionalfeature.name: I Just Think They're Neat

entries: This eldritch invocation is taken/modified from All Beneath the Yonder Seas and Streams: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QfoBtuqEpGQMcVuvbBbZKOAVQJFOOiy2/view
Cursed magic items don't count against the total number of items that you can attune to.

optionalfeature.name: Mariner

entries: This fighting style is taken/modified from UA Waterborne Adventures: https://media.wizards.com/2015/downloads/dnd/UA_Waterborne_v3.pdf
As long as you are not wearing heavy armor or using a shield, you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

optionalfeature.name: Disorienting Blow
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to disorient the target, forcing the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn, and if that attack hits, roll the superiority die twice and subtract the sum from the damage it deals.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Load
entries: When you make an attack with a ranged weapon, you can expend one superiority die to ignore the weapon's Loading property, load it without a free hand, and sheathe it without using an object interaction until the end of your turn. Add the superiority die to the damage roll of the next attack you make with the weapon that hits before the end of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Staggering Attack
entries: When you hit a creature no more than two sizes larger than you with a two-handed melee weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to try to stagger it. Add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 and be rendered breathless and unable to speak until the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Whirling Defense
entries: As a bonus action on your turn while wielding a melee weapon, you can expend one superiority die to zealously guard every space in your reach until the start of your next turn. Roll the superiority die and add it to the AC of other creatures of your choice within your reach. Creatures moving through the area (including yourself) must spend 2 feet of movement for each foot they move.

optionalfeature.name: Compacted Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that affects an area, you can spend one sorcery point to reduce the radius or side length of the area by a number of feet up to 5 times your Charisma modifier (min 5 feet). If the spell deals extra damage when upcast, it deals extra damage as though upcast by one level per 5 feet reduced.
Line spells can be reduced by a number of feet up to 20 times your Charisma modifier (min 20 feet), but only gains the extra damage of being upcast by one level per 20 feet reduced.

optionalfeature.name: Improvised Spell
entries: You may spend two sorcery points to cast a spell you don't know on the sorcerer spell list.
This race is taken/modified from One Grung Above: http://citrusbolt.net/files/dnd/One%20Grung%20Above.pdf

entries.name: Age
entries: Grung mature to adulthood in a single year, but have been known to live up to 50 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Grung stand between 2½ and 3½ feet tall and average about 30 pounds. Your size is small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: You have a walking speed of 25 feet and a climb speed of 25 feet.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Arboreal Alertness
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception skill and with the grung whistle stick.

entries.name: Poison Immunity
entries: You're immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.

entries.name: Poisonous Skin
entries: Any creature that comes into direct contact with your skin for the first time on its turn must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn.

You can also apply this poison to any weapon as part of an attack with the weapon. If the target takes any damage from the attack, they must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 2d4 poison damage.
In either case, the DC for the saving throw is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries: Your long jump is up to 25 feet and your high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Water Dependency
entries: If you fail to immerse yourself in water for at least 1 hour during a day, you suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion} at the end of that day. You can only recover from this exhaustion through magic or by immersing yourself in water for at least 1 hour.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Grung.
Vibrant, colourful jungle frogs. 'nuff said.

entries.name: Grung Names
entries: Grung names tend to be segmented into two to five syllables by contractive single-letter consonants such as d, b, and r. There's no particular difference between male and female names, and grung don't use family names. Instead, as a tribe grows and names must be more distinguishable, additional syllables are added to the names. Grung usually pick a name for themselves when they mature, being nameless or going by temporary names while they're tadpoles, but they sometimes take on their temporary name permanently.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-dhampir mature at the same rate as their mortal parent's race, but age half as quickly.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-dhampir are the same size as their mortal parent's race but slightly lighter. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: You have a walking speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't perceive colour in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Vampiric Heritage
entries: You are resistant to necrotic damage, and can cast {@spell Charm Person|PHB} at 1st level. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast {@spell Spider Climb|PHB} at 2nd level. Once you reach 5th level, you can cast {@spell Gaseous Form|PHB} and {@spell Vampiric Touch|PHB} at 3rd level. Once you cast any of these spells, you must finish a long rest before you can cast that spell again using this trait. When you cast any of these spells in this way, Charisma is your spellcasting ability, they don't require any material components, and the ranges of Spider Climb and Gaseous Form become Self. If you take any radiant damage, you lose use of this trait and your darkvision until the end of your next turn, and you have disadvantage on the concentration saving throw for an innately-cast spell.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

Dhampir are the result of a vampire's union with a mortal, possessing many of the vampire's strengths and lacking most of its weaknesses. Most significantly, they still experience the vampire's eternal thirst for the blood of the living, though they don't require it to survive. Only some dhampir manage the restraint to control their urges.

Half-dhampir are one step further removed, being the offspring of a dhampir and a mortal. As such, they possess only a few of the vampire's strengths in a limited capacity, but none of the weaknesses. They might experience a slight craving for blood when particularly hungry, but one that can be satisfied by slightly-undercooked meat. Taking radiant damage temporarily suppresses their inherited abilities, but doesn't sting any more than it would for another mortal.

entries.name: Human Versatility
entries: Your age, size, speed, and languages known are all the same as any other human, but you gain the benefits of the {@feat Magic Initiate} and {@feat Skilled} feats.
This race is taken/modified from Call from the Deep: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QfoBtuqEpGQMcVuvbBbZKOAVQJFOOiy2/view

entries.name: Age
entries: Merfolk mature at the same rate as humans and have lifespans of similar length to theirs.

entries.name: Size
entries: Merfolk are around six feet tall including their tails, and weight between 200 and 250 pounds. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 10 feet, and you have a swimming speed of 50 feet.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You are used to navigating the murky depths of the sea and have superior vision in dim and dark conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Deep Sea Survivors
entries: You're naturally gifted in survival techniques, especially underwater. You gain proficiency in the Perception and Survival skills. While swimming, moving a creature that you have grappled while they are incapacitated does not halve your speed. Additionally, while swimming, you can {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} as a bonus action. You have resistance to cold damage, and also ignore any drawbacks related to being underwater including high pressure, and strong currents.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: You know the {@spell Shape Water|XGE} cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting modifier for this spell.

entries.name: Mercantile Culture
entries: Merfolk culture is frequently based around trading with surface dwellers. Because of this, merfolk gain a knack for trade. You add your proficiency to checks made to bargain and communicate with merchants and traders.

entries.name: Underwater Weapons Training
entries: You gain proficiency with spears, javelins and tridents. Ranged attacks with these weapons don’t automatically miss a target beyond 30 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Aquan.

Merfolk are aquatic humanoids with the upper body of a human and the lower body of a fish. They are common throughout the oceans of the Forgotten Realms, and their settlements are as varied in colour, culture and outlook as the human races of the surface. Most merfolk communities are semi-nomadic, as the aquatic folk lack the skills to forge metal or carve stone. Instead, their settlements are founded in undersea caverns, coral mazes, and sunken cities.

Many merfolk communities survive by trading with other undersea communities, such as tritons and sea elves. Because craft and trade is part of almost all merfolk cultures, these folk are renowned for their ability to barter with the best merchants of the realms.

entries.name: Merfolk Names
entries: Merfolk names are not dissimilar to human names in sound and flow, though sometimes contain more vowel sounds to make them easier to pronounce beneath the waves. Merfolk family names are passed down either the matriarchal or patriarchal line, depending on the culture.
This race is a slightly nerfed version of the original Warforged Unearthed Arcana, while they still had distinct subraces. Those three subraces have also been modified as follows:
{@race Warforged (Envoy)|FA}
{@race Warforged (Juggernaut)|FA}
{@race Warforged (Skirmisher)|FA}

entries.name: Age
entries: Warforged have no known maximum lifespan, and have shown no signs of deterioration from age at up to 50 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Warforged come in a variety of heights and forms, but are humanoid in appearance. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Integrated Protection
entries: You have built-in armour, but can't use any armour except shields. If another feature lets you add your proficiency bonus to your AC, you may double it if you're armoured. Each time you finish a long rest, choose one of the following protection modes:

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours of it in an inactive, motionless state. You appear unconscious, but can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: You have resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} or becoming diseased. You don't need to eat, drink, breathe, or sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common.

Warforged are formed from a blend of organic and non-organic materials. Root-like cords infused with alchemical fluids serve as their muscles, wrapped around a framework of steel, darkwood, or stone. Armoured plates form a protective outer shell and reinforce joints. Warforged share a common facial design, with a hinged jaw and crystal eyes embedded beneath a reinforced brow ridge. Beyond these common elements of warforged design, the precise materials and build of a warforged vary based on the purpose for which it was designed. Warforged are tough and resilient, both physically and mentally, and tend to be the most loyal and determined servants, friends, and leaders. They can also be the most cold-hearted of killers.

entries.name: Warforged Names
entries: Warforged often take on names reflective of their occupation or purpose, or adopt a nickname given to them by a comrade. Some take on the names of fallen friends or mentors; others take on the name of a culture they've become entangled with. Still others choose the name of a location that has great meaning to them.

items.name: Names:
items.entry: Anchor, Banner, Bastion, Blade, Blue, Bow, Church, Crunch, Crystal, Dagger, Dent, Five, Glaive, Hammer, Iron, Lucky, Mace, Pants, Pierce, Red, Rusty, Scout, Seven, Shield, Slash, Smith, Spike, Stone, Temple, Vault, Wall, Wood

entries.name: Integrated Tool
entries: Choose a tool you're proficient with. It becomes integrated into your body, and you double your proficiency bonus for any ability checks you make with it.

entries.name: Specialized Design
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice and a total of two additional tools or languages.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: Your carrying capacity - and the weight you can push, drag, and lift - is doubled.

entries.name: Powerful Strike
entries: As an action, you can make one unarmed strike which is Heavy and Versatile. The damage dice are a number of d4s (Versatile: d6s) equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Siege Weapon
entries: You deal double damage to objects, and have advantage on Strength checks to break down doors or perform similar feats.

entries.name: Quick Mind
entries: You can give yourself a bonus to initiative rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Swift
entries: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.

spell.name: Blasting Blade

components.m: a melee weapon worth at least 1sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and then becomes sheathed in surging energy. If the target does not move at least 5 feet before the end of its next turn, the energy field detonates and the target takes 1d8 force damage.

This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra 1d8 force damage to the target on a hit, and the damage the target takes for not moving increases to 2d8. Both damage rolls increase by 1d8 at 11th level (2d8 and 3d8) and again at 17th level (3d8 and 4d8).

spell.name: Forget

entries: This spell is taken/modified from the Compendium of Forgotten Secrets Awakening: https://www.genfantasypress.com/

You temporarily suppress a memory, sealing it away from your mind. You can choose either one period of time, a single person, group, or activity, or any other singular thing, such as a plan or proficiency in a single skill. Any creature other than you attempting to access this memory via magic or other means must make a Wisdom saving throw. If they succeed, this spell ends. When the spell ends, the memory returns and springs to your mind, fresh and vivid.

spell.name: Pressure Stream

entries: This spell is taken/modified from All Beneath the Yonder Seas and Streams: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QfoBtuqEpGQMcVuvbBbZKOAVQJFOOiy2/view

A wire-thin stream of pressurized water shoots from your finger, with devastating yet precise cutting power at point-blank range. Make a melee spell attack against a creature or object you can reach. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 piercing damage. If the target is a creature or object made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal, the spell deals maximum damage to it. You can’t target an object that is being worn or carried by an unwilling creature.
The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

spell.name: Rippling Orb

entries: This spell is taken/modified from All Beneath the Yonder Seas and Streams: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QfoBtuqEpGQMcVuvbBbZKOAVQJFOOiy2/view

You hurl a rippling fist-sized mass of water at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the creature takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage, and if the creature is Large or smaller, it is pushed up to 10 feet away from you.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

spell.name: Aura of Alertness
entries: Refreshing energy radiates from you in a 30-foot-radius aura. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. Each friendly creature in the aura (including you) gains a +3 bonus to initiative checks.

Additionally, any effect on a friendly creature within the aura which is rendering it incapacitated but which may be ended by use of an action (as with Sleep or Hypnotic Pattern) may instead be ended with the use of a bonus action.

spell.name: Enhance Potion
entries: Using your Alchemist's Supplies, you can enhance a potion. You touch a potion or an Experimental Elixir and choose one of the following effects:

If the potion has a duration, you may double the duration of the potion, up to a maximum of one additional hour. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher and choose this option, the maximum additional time increases by one hour for each slot level above 1st.

If the potion deals damage or heals, you roll one additional die to determine the healing or damage done. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you roll an additional die to determine the healing or damage done for each slot level above 1st.
These effects last for the spell's duration, or until you cast this spell again on the same potion.

spell.name: Iota's Exploding Squid

entries: This spell is taken/modified from All Beneath the Yonder Seas and Streams: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QfoBtuqEpGQMcVuvbBbZKOAVQJFOOiy2/view

You summon a squid and fling it at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the squid explodes in a burst of ink. The target takes {@damage 1d12} piercing damage and becomes blinded until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you summon an additional squid for each slot level above 1st. You can fling them at one target or several.

spell.name: Poisoned Weapon

components.m: A poisoner's kit or alchemist supplies

entries: As a bonus action, you touch a weapon and coat it with a poisonous substance. The next time that weapon deals damage during the spell's duration, it deals an additional {@damage 2d6} poison damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature it must make a Constitution Saving Throw or become poisoned for the duration of the spell. A creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Rimesworn Blade

entries: This spell is taken/modified from the Compendium of Forgotten Secrets Awakening: https://www.genfantasypress.com/

The first time you take the Attack action during your turn, you can cast this spell to infuse your martial weapon with chilling cold and coat the exterior with brittle ice. The first time you hit with this weapon, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d8} cold damage, shattering the ice on your weapon. The target and creatures within 10 feet of the target other than you must make a Dexterity saving throw. If they fail, they take {@damage 1d8} piercing damage. If you do not hit a creature with the martial weapon on your turn, the ice dissipates.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, either the cold or piercing damage (your choice) increases by {@damage 1d8} per slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Riptide

entries: This spell is taken/modified from All Beneath the Yonder Seas and Streams: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QfoBtuqEpGQMcVuvbBbZKOAVQJFOOiy2/view

You create a fast current within a body of water, forming a line 90 feet long and 10 feet wide in a direction of your choice extending away from a point you can see within range. Each creature that starts its turn in the line must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and pushed 30 feet in the direction following the line. A creature in the line must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot that it moves when moving against the tide.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, each creature in the line moving against the tide must spend an extra 1 foot of movement for every 1 foot it moves for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Salt Spray

entries: This spell is taken/modified from All Beneath the Yonder Seas and Streams: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QfoBtuqEpGQMcVuvbBbZKOAVQJFOOiy2/view

A burst of salty ocean mist erupts from your palms. Each creature in a 15-foot cone make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes an additional {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage each time it takes any piercing or slashing damage before the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the additional damage increases by {@damage 1d4} for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Waterspout

entries: This spell is taken/modified from All Beneath the Yonder Seas and Streams: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QfoBtuqEpGQMcVuvbBbZKOAVQJFOOiy2/view

You cause a spout of water to emerge from a 5-foot-square on the ground. Water emerges to fill a 20-foot-tall cylinder with a 5-foot diameter that rises from the chosen square and lasts for the duration.

A creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Dexterity saving throw, which it can choose to fail. On a failed save, a creature is pushed to the top of the cylinder. On a successful save, a creature is pushed 5 feet out of the area into an unoccupied space of the creature’s choice. If no unoccupied space is available, the creature automatically fails the saving throw.

The force of the water is enough to keep creatures aloft, though it is impossible for a creature to stand at the top of the waterspout unless it can normally stand on water. A creature that can’t stand on water is prone while it remains at the top of the cylinder. Water created by this spell vanishes when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the height of the cylinder increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cold Snap

entries: This spell is taken/modified from KibblesTasty: https://www.kthomebrew.com/

A swirling burst of freezing wind erupts at a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
The ground in the area is covered with slick ice, making it difficult terrain until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Dark Secret

entries: This spell is taken/modified from the Compendium of Forgotten Secrets Awakening: https://www.genfantasypress.com/

You whisper a phrase into the mind of the target, unknown to you but clear and terrifying to them. Until the end of your next turn, you have advantage on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws involving your target or actions it has taken. During this time, the target has disadvantage on all ability checks and attack rolls involving you or actions you have taken. Targets that are immune to being frightened are immune to this effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can choose one additional target per spell slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Greater Witch Bolt
entries: A beam of crackling, blue energy lances out towards two creatures within range. Make a ranged spell attack against each target. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} lightning damage, and a sustained arc of lightning forms between you and that target.

On each of your subsequent turns for the spell's duration, you can use an action to rejuvenate the arcs. The arc to a creature is broken if that creature is outside the spell's range or behind total cover when you use this action. Each creature that is still linked to you by an arc after you've taken this action takes {@damage 2d6} lightning damage.

You can use your reaction when a target is reduced to 0 hit points to attempt to shift the arc to another creature within 10 feet of the target. Make a ranged spell attack against the new target; on a hit, the sustained arc shifts to link you and the new target. Hit or miss, until the start of your next turn you can attempt to shift targets when linked creatures are reduced to 0 hit points without requiring your reaction.

The spell ends if all arcs are broken, if you don't use an action on your turn to sustain the arcs, or if you are holding objects other than the focus or material component you used to cast the spell in both hands.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level above 2nd, you may target an additional creature and the initial damage increases by {@damage 1d6}.

spell.name: Lightning Charged

entries: This spell is taken/modified from KibblesTasty: https://www.kthomebrew.com/
You channel lightning energy into a creature. The energy is harmless to the creature, but escapes in dangerous bursts to other nearby creatures.

Every time that creature strikes another creature with a melee attack, a spell with a range of touch, is struck by another creature with a melee attack, or ends their turn while grappling or being grappled by another creature, they deal {@damage 1d6} lightning damage to that creature.
Once this spell has discharged 6 times (dealing up to 6d6 damage), the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell can discharge an additional 2 times (dealing up to 2d6 more damage) before the spell ends for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Psychic Anchor

entries: This spell is taken/modified from All Beneath the Yonder Seas and Streams: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QfoBtuqEpGQMcVuvbBbZKOAVQJFOOiy2/view

Choose a creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw or become bound by a psychic anchor, which weighs it down and slows its movements. While weighed down, the creature’s speed is reduced by 20 feet, it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws that use Strength or Dexterity, and it sinks 30 feet at the start of its turn if it is swimming. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Intelligence saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional target for each slot level above 2nd. The targets must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Skystrike

time.condition: when you are falling or after jumping

entries: This spell is taken/modified from the Compendium of Forgotten Secrets Awakening: https://www.genfantasypress.com/

When you cast this spell, choose a point on the ground within 15 feet of where you would land. You instantly crash to the ground at that point, accompanied by a flash of lightning. You take no falling damage, but if you land on a creature or a space within 5 feet of a creature, it takes {@damage 1d6} lightning damage for every 10 feet you fell to a maximum of {@damage 4d6}. If you land on a creature, you immediately move to the nearest open space instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher, the maximum damage increases by {@damage 2d6} for each spell slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Sword Smash
entries: You summon a giant sword of light at a point within range, which immediately crashes down in a line 30 feet long and 10 feet wide. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d12} radiant damage and be knocked prone. A creature knocked prone by the spell must repeat the saving throw the first time it tries to stand up before the end of its next turn, falling prone again on a failure.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level above 2nd, the damage increases by {@damage 1d12} and the length of the line increases by 10 feet.

spell.name: Xandala's Hopeful Hyacinth
entries: As part of the action to cast this spell, you may take the Attack Action to summon a swirl of purple hyacinth petals to surround your weapon, filling you with hope and enabling you to strike with great power. Each successful hit you make with this weapon before the spell ends, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw or have a new effect apply. Once you've made three weapon attacks the spell ends, regardless of whether the attacks hit.

entries.name: 1st hit
entries: If the target fails their saving throw, its movement speed is halved and it must use its reaction to move as far as its speed allows away from you.

entries.name: 2nd hit
entries: If the target fails their saving throw, it takes 2d6 damage and cannot take reactions until the end of your next turn. Choose one of the d6s. The number rolled on that die determines the spell's damage type, as shown below.

entries.name: 3rd hit
entries: If the target fails their saving throw, it takes 3d6 damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn. Choose one of the d6s. The number rolled on that die determines the spell's damage type, as shown below.

If you roll the same number on two of the d6s on the 2nd or 3rd hit, the chaotic energy leaps from the target to a different creature of your choice within 10 feet of it. The creature takes the same damage as was rolled from the spell.

spell.name: Bulwark of Protection

components.m: A weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You stab the the weapon into the ground, and a 15-foot-radius dome of shimmering, translucent force appears around and above you and remains stationary for the duration. Spells and other magical effects can't pass through the dome or be cast through it. Weapon attacks and ammunition from weapon attacks likewise can't pass through the dome.
A creature can only pass through the dome once per turn.
When a friendly creature enters the dome on its turn or starts its turn there, it gains {@dice 1d6} temporary hitpoints. The temporary hitpoints are lost upon exiting the dome.
In addition, any friendly creature in the dome can't be frightened, and they can choose to no longer be frightened if they are (no action required).
At the start of each of your turns, a friendly creature occupying the center space of the dome regains {@dice 1d6} hitpoints.

spell.name: Xorn Talons of Manshoon

components.m: A clay claw with three talons

entries: Choose a point you can see on the ground within range. The ground transmutes into grasping claws of stone and earth which lash out at in a 15-foot-radius circle centered on that point. Each creature in that area must make a Strength Saving Throw.
A creature takes {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save and is restrained until the end of your next turn, or half as much on a successful saving throw and isn't restrained.

spell.name: Grasping Roots
entries: Roots sprout from the ground in a 30-foot-radius circle centered on a point that you can see within range. The affected area becomes difficult terrain. When you cast this spell, you can direct the roots to lash out at a creature you can see within 30 feet of the roots. That creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be pulled 30 feet towards the center of the roots, following the most direct path possible.
Until the spell ends, you can direct the roots to lash out again as a bonus action on each of your turns.

spell.name: Eye of the Storm
entries: You call upon the wrathful power of the storm, wreathing yourself in crackling lightning. Until the spell ends, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have a Fly (hover) speed equal to your walking speed.
You have resistance to lightning damage.
When a creature hits you with a melee attack, crackling electricity leaps from your body, dealing {@damage 1d8} lightning damage to the attacker. A creature can only be harmed by this once a turn.

When you cast this spell, and as an action on following turns, lightning erupts from your body in a massive storm of electricity. All creatures within 20 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} lightning damage, or half on a success. Until the start of your next turn, you instead have immunity to lightning damage.

spell.name: Gravity Smash

entries: This spell is taken/modified from the Heliana's Guide to Monster Hunting: https://loottavern.com/

You strike the ground, choosing a point you can see within range to begin accumulating gravity. All creatures in the area begin to levitate up to 20ft into the air and remain suspended there for the duration. A target without a flying speed can only move by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing.

When the spell ends at the start of your next turn, the gravity reaches a critical magnitude, smashing all creatures in the cylinder downwards; each creature in the area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes {@damage 6d10} force damage. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage. If the spell ends before the start of your next turn, the damage it deals on a failed saving throw is {@damage 3d10} instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Lunar Manifestation

entries: This spell is taken/modified from the Darkhold: Secrets of the Zhentarim: https://www.dmsguild.com/product/324679/Darkhold-Secrets-of-the-Zhentarim
A gleaming white 30-foot-radius sphere resembling the moon briefly flashes into existence at a point you choose within range. You can choose to manifest this sphere as a full moon or a lunar eclipse.

When a full moon is manifested, each creature within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 7d6} radiant damage and is blinded for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

When a lunar eclipse is manifested, each creature within the area must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 7d6} necrotic damage and is frightened of all hostile creatures for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't frightened.
A creature blinded or frightened by this spell makes another saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the effect ends.
Lycanthropes have disadvantage on these saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Sunken Herald
entries: Your innate magic comes from strange undersea powers, spawned from creatures of the deep that lurk in furtive darkness. Krakens, merrow, sea hags and other marine horrors often abduct thralls from the surface, controlling them with hypnotic magic before discarding them and leaving them forever changed. You have a connection to one of these thralls—or could even be one of these thralls yourself—as the descendant of a deep scion, a child stolen by a sea hag, or someone anointed as an acolyte by a circle of kraken priests. Your inextricable connection to the depths warps your body and soul into strange, alien forms that terrify your terrestrial allies. Above all, the sea lures your mind, bringing you both calm and deep foreboding near the open waters.

Regardless of the source of your power, you fill those that lay eyes upon you with dread. The terrors of the depths and the horrors that live on the cold, black seafloor weave their way into your magic and your very body. Despite this, powerful Sunken Heralds tend to become the leaders of far-reaching cults and powerful secret societies.

subclassFeature.name: Between Worlds
entries: Your foul ancestry grants you abilities some consider unnatural. At 1st level, you learn Deep Speech, can breathe both air and water, and have a swim speed equal to your walking speed. Additionally, you can walk across the surface of liquid water as if it were solid ground.

subclassFeature.name: Malleable Flesh
entries: At 1st level, you can cause the magic that flows through your veins to shift and change your body to suit your needs. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can modify your body in one of the ways listed below. If you cast a spell of 2nd level or higher, you can choose one additional feature for each slot level above 1st.

entries.name: Elongated Limbs
entries: Your arms and legs snap and stretch unnaturally, tripling in length. Your reach is increased to 10 feet on your turns, and your speed increases by 10 feet.

entries.name: Freakish Graft
entries: Your flesh swells and expands before lashing out to one object, structure or creature within 30 feet, mingling them together. You can’t be disarmed of the item or drop it. If you are holding a structure or object too large for you to move, you can’t be moved more than 30 feet away from that object. If you target a creature, you may attempt to grapple them.

entries.name: Mucosal Escape
entries: Thick, foul slime coats your skin. You have advantage on checks to avoid being grappled, and opportunity attacks against you are made at disadvantage.

entries.name: Net of Veins
entries: Your wrists burst into a web of blood vessels that anchor on structures and objects that aren’t being worn or carried within 60 feet of you. Your net of veins moves with you, centered on you, as they continuously attach to objects and structures in areas you enter and detach from where you leave. Until this effect ends, you have advantage on checks and saves to avoid being knocked prone and can use a bonus action to pull a Small or smaller object within range that isn’t being worn or carried into your space.

entries.name: Predator's Claws
entries: Your nails lengthen and sharpen into thin, translucent spindles. You can make unarmed strikes with these claws, using Constitution in place of Strength for the attack roll. On a hit, your claws do 1d8 + Constitution modifier magical slashing damage. You also gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Salt and Sunder
entries: Corrosive brine drips from your hands, which become pitted and blackened. Your attacks and spells deal double damage against objects.

subclassFeature.name: Weird Reconstruction
entries: At 6th level, the bizarre biology that gave you life allows you to reform your body in horrific ways. When you take damage you can use your reaction to reduce the damage taken by your sorcerer level. If your sorcerer level is greater than the damage taken, you gain the difference as temporary hit points. If the source of damage was a creature and it can see you, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is frightened of you until the end of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Monstrous Mass
entries: At 14th level, your contorting, inhuman body terrifies and disorients your enemies. When you activate Malleable Flesh by casting a spell of 6th level or higher, each creature of your choice that is within 60 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your sorcerer spell save DC. On a failed save, a target is frightened of you until your transformation ends. While transformed in this way, frightened creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against your spells. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success. After the effect ends or it succeeds the saving throw, it is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Pelagic Nightmare
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can spend 5 sorcery points as an action to temporarily manifest images of an ancient, sunken city around yourself for 1 minute. All light within 120 feet of you is reduced to dim light, and creatures of your choice must use their swimming speed to move through the area, rather than their walking speed, and can’t benefit from cover. When you create this effect, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by the visions of ocean depths. When a designated creature casts a spell or makes an attack while in the area, it can treat any point within 120 feet of you as the origin of the effect, as though it were standing in that space.
